channel.title: What does this error mean?
channel.description: load up a server says 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file press any key to continue.... and i know what this means like maybe 70% i got newest java, jdk everything using windows 7 btw and it doesnt work still

item.title: What does this error mean?
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Despair Mr. Despair
item.description:
@Mr_Despair wrote:

Java isn’t recognizing Java, set your environmental variables. Use http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,372873.0.html for info on how to do this. Once done, use this compile code.

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

It’ll find your Java automatically.

Read full topic

item.title: What does this error mean?

item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

i can’t really explain considering im on a friends computer and he doesn’t even have java. tommorow (i live in texas, usa) i can help u on teamviewer if you want. just use my website (in my sig) and well keep in touch there this is probably the last time ill ever b on moparscape

item.title: What does this error mean?
item.dc:creator: @X-X_G_X-X X-X--G--X-X
item.description:
@X-X_G_X-X wrote:

get the right path from your java files, make sure it leads to the right java… here is my run.bat command

@echo off
title Black Angel
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m server
pause

that means, that java.exe is located in my program files and its in java, jdk 6u18.

Read full topic

item.title: What does this error mean?
item.dc:creator: @Javafire Javafire
item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

you need to get the right version of java, then after that redirect the file source in the compiler or run.bat code (simple enough?)
